meanings.definition: A graft of tissue from one part of the body to another part of the same body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor performed an autograft to repair the damaged knee.
meanings.sent2: The autograft procedure involved moving skin from the arm to cover the burn on the leg.
meanings.sent3: During the surgery, the autograft made the injured area look like a patchwork quilt.
meanings.sent4: The autograft acted like a natural bandage, protecting the wound as it healed.
meanings.sent5: The autograft seamlessly blended in with the surrounding tissue, aiding in the recovery process.

meanings.definition: To transplant tissue from one part of the body to another part of the same body.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon had to autograft skin to reconstruct the damaged area.
meanings.sent2: She decided to autograft muscle to improve the function of the injured limb.
meanings.sent3: Autografting the tissue felt like rearranging puzzle pieces inside the body.
meanings.sent4: The idea to autograft the organ came to him like a sudden revelation.
meanings.sent5: The patient's body accepted the autografted tissue as if it belonged there all along.
